intro: Erodium oxyrhinchum subsp. bryoniifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and is often found in coastal regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
